original_title: President orders strict legislation to prevent child abuse
original_body_lines: President Ranil Wickremesinghe has ordered strict legislation to prevent child abuse, emphasizing the urgency of combating the issue perpetrated by teachers, elders and various segments of society, following recent incidents of abuse including the death of a 16-year-old girl and the abuse of 16 children by a tuition teacher, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.
In addition, President Wickremesinghe has also stated that a separate set of laws should be introduced in order to safeguard the children of the country.

The President has pointed out the need to amend the existing laws for that purpose and informed to pay special attention to the incidents of child abuse via mobile phones and social media while preparing this legal system.
Accordingly, once the relevant laws are drafted they will be submitted to the Parliament and passed, the PMD reported.
